supply_logistics.supply_status: Adequate for defensive operations. Division newly arrived in theater (24 July 1942), underwent acclimatization training east of Cairo. Forward deployment to El Alamein in mid-August strained supply lines. Primary constraints: extended supply route from base depots, desert heat affecting perishables, water requirements for 18,000 personnel in desert conditions.

tactical_doctrine.role: Infantry division trained for offensive and defensive operations. Deployed to North Africa as reinforcement for Eighth Army. First major action at Battle of Alam el Halfa (30 Aug - 7 Sep 1942) where division held defensive positions on Alam el Halfa Ridge against German/Italian attacks.
special_capabilities: Newly arrived division with high morale and full strength
Well-trained in UK but limited desert warfare experience upon arrival
Effective anti-tank defense (1/7th Queen's knocked out 27 German tanks with 6-pounders)
known_issues: Limited desert warfare experience in July-August 1942
Acclimatization challenges for troops from UK
132nd Brigade suffered heavy casualties (nearly 700) when attached to NZ Division
133rd Brigade detached permanently on 8 September, reducing division strength
tactical_doctrine.desert_adaptations: Division underwent intensive desert training east of Cairo before deployment. Adapted tactics for desert conditions including water discipline, vehicle maintenance in sand/dust, and heat management for personnel.
